reviews.title: Do Not Recommend
reviews.review_text: This 4-shelf storage cabinet with doors would be a great place to store items out of sight and organized, whether you use it in the garage, study, craft room or game room. However, it is plastic and not very sturdy. The shelves can hold only 30 pounds so the items that can be stored in this cabinet are limited. I’m not sure I’d trust a shelf to hold a 6-pack of soda. When you open the box, be surprised to find cracked or broken pieces, missing or duplicate pieces. If you receive all the pieces in good condition, be extremely careful during assembly. This storage cabinet is fairly easy to put together. No tools are required but a rubber mallet may come in handy. Read the assembly instructions, lay out all the parts, take your time and try not to get frustrated. It took me and my daughter longer than it would for most people, even though both of us have years of experience assembling boxed furniture. I cannot, in good faith, recommend this storage cabinet. A metal/steel cabinet, with or without doors, would be a much better investment even though the cost is more.
Missing a part. Waiting to hear if I will receive the part or if I will have to disassemble the cabinet so I can return it
Save your money. This shelving system is cheaply made. The doors don't stay shut. Also, the doors come apart easily as you open it.

reviews.title: looks different
reviews.review_text: This is the second cabinet I bought, I thought it would match the other one but they added lines on the door and the color is different.

reviews.title: OK COULD BE STRONGER
reviews.review_text: Over all not as heavy duty as expected. shelve so weak had to make wooden frames to secure them. i am using it to store canned and boxed food. so cans are heavy. But it is ok.

reviews.title: Buy Something Else If For Outside Use
reviews.review_text: I liked that it's hard plastic and that the shelves do seem to be able to hold the 50lbs per shelf. I also really liked that you don't need any tools to put it together. However, this is not suitable to be outside where rain can get to it. Especially because the doors do not close all of the way (including on the sides), water will be able to get in if it is rained on. This is also expensive for what it is. A better price would have been about $80. If you'll have this in the house and don't need the doors to completely close, buy it. If you need it to be outside, buy something else.

reviews.title: Good points, bad points
reviews.review_text: The product itself is good except for what I am guessing is a piece that is supposed to represent a middle hinge on the doors. Didn't work, both sides broke off the first time I opened the doors. No matter...doors function fine without them. Big plus, this whole assembly requires NO hardware. On the negative side the instructions leave a lot to be desired especially as far the pictures go. Black on black so doesn't work. It also doesn't work far as the parts being labeled. Took the light hitting just right that I finally even noticed they were labeled. I was about halfway through assembly before I saw them...duh. It did go together well even with the broken middle "hinges?" Works well, Shelves are sturdy so all in all I am good with the unit. My biggest bone to pick is Walmart delivery. When I first saw this product in the store there were 3 units sitting on the shelf. I went home and price checked the unit in other places and not only did Walmart have the best price my CC provided a link that allowed me to get 5% cash back.....BONUS. Yeah, so I ordered through the link for pickup the next day. I soon get a noticed telling me not available for pickup and they would ship it to me. Now I'm thinking WOW they sold the 3 units I saw sitting on the shelf that morning. I get the unit a couple days latter via, FEDEX. Assemble it, get it into use...happy camper. UNTIL I am shopping at Walmart a day or so later and low and behold.....all 3 units are still sitting on the shelf. Gotta wonder whether it was a management issue, some weird policy issue or lazy employee issue but someone really needs to address that. 5% cash back to me and God only knows what they paid FedEx to ship it to me. On a $120 purchase the profit margin must be out the roof for them to make any money on that deal. Rant over.
Easy to assemble. Sturdy. Had to duct tape the shelves when I placed them on the s mall hooks as they tended to not hook firmly.
I ordered it in the morning and got it by the afternoon
This is the second one I've purchased of the tall one and one of the short one which I may buy another short one in the future
INSTRUCTIONS AND FIGURES EASY TO FOLLOW; DOORS A LITTLE FLOPPY WHEN OPENING AND CLOSING; SHELVES DIFFICULT TO SLIDE IN INITIALLY
seemed overpriced for plastic to be that flimsy but was fast and easy to assemble
The shelves don't lock into place so items fall when opening the doors

reviews.title: It's ok
reviews.review_text: It does the job, but not high quality. I needed a temporary solution and is serving the requirement.

reviews.title: Easy to put together, not very sturdy
reviews.review_text: I got this because I needed some more storage in my garage for holiday decorations. My husband put it together while I was at work. He said that it was very easy because the parts snapped together, but that there were no screws or anything as back up to hold them together. It also doesn't seem very sturdy while its sitting empty. If you bump the shelves with nothing on them they move. It also seems like it would be very easy to knock over. Thankfully I am putting this in my detached garage where my children can not get to it, but I would definitely be away of the amount of traffic in the areas you put it in so that it doesn't fall.

reviews.title: Replace part N for top of garage
reviews.review_text: Part broken I have reached out four times now to have this price Replace. By me being in a power chair I had it delivered and hard to find someone to return the whole thing after it has been put together. This goes at the top of cabinet. I like a replacement piece send to my address. Thank you .

reviews.title: Poor quality for what it needs to be used for
reviews.review_text: This hyper tough 4 shelf utility cabinet is made of durable polypropylene material. It can hold up to 30lb per shelf when evenly distributed. The total cupboard weighs 36.4 pounds. It has a matte black finish and comes with detailed instructions to assemble it. Each piece is labeled with a letter that is engraved in the plastic. Assembled it is 18.5 inches long, 25.47 inches wide and 69.38 inches tall. It can be used in bedrooms, bathrooms, patios, garages, and more. It has 4 shelves that are moveable. When I put it together the main part of cupboard was super easy and understandable. Once it came to putt in the shelves it got very confusing. They didn’t fit, took multiple tried to get one shelf to stay in and would require me to push the left “wall” in to get it to snap together. Overall it will work well for holding light simple items but the shelves do collapse sometimes. It is poor quality and flimsy for what it is.

reviews.title: Not great, but good enough
reviews.review_text: The doors need help closing as it the guide hook isn’t always in the guide slot. So the door will bulge out if it isn’t closed a certain way. It is a plastic storage, so it isn’t too great, BUT, aside from the door issue, it does what it was meant for.

reviews.title: easy to put together and easy to move and lift.
reviews.review_text: Hyper Tough Tall 4 Shelf Storage Cabinet ''Purchased for a gift'' This unit comes with instructions, but was still a bit difficult for me to put together and too me at least an hour to figure it out. when putting together there has to be some presure applied so it clics together properly, After i finally assembled it, one of the doors ept coming off every time i opened and moved it. the other door was ok and stayed put, so not sure if its a defect or i needed to tighten each part on correctly, so i took apart and put back together and it still did same thing. not sure if i will send back or let the person i purchased this as a gift for, deal with the issue and see if they can fix the problem.Overall a nice Cabinet not very heavy and easy to move around when empty. Only Gave three Star rating due to the door issue. but hoping this will be resolved.

reviews.title: Easy assembly
reviews.review_text: I found this HyperTough Garage Storage Soultions Cabinet quiet purposeful. At 25" wide x 18" deep and almost 70" high with 4 adjustable shelves. All pieces are durable plastic much like a tote. I placed it in my workshop/shed to hide my garden supplies, small tools and fertilzers. I also am keeping my car care/washing chemicals, waxs, soaps towels. It took me about an hour to assemble. It would have been nice to have assembly instructions but I managed to figure it out. Nice not to have to use any screws , nuts or bolts, all the pieces just snapped into place. I did have to get out my rubber mallot as some pieces I had ti disassemble as there was an order to put the pieces together. 20 pieces altogether. Which included doors on the front to enclose the shelves. I had a small 1 inch pieces that broke off but you can't see it from tbe front. Overall I am satisfied with my HyperTough storage cabinet.

reviews.title: Broken pieces, flimsy, confusing instructions
reviews.review_text: The first box had broken pieces, fine, no problem. We received a replacement pretty quickly and were ready to give it another shot. More broken pieces. We just built it anyway, as the broken parts in the second box were usable even with cracks. Parts of the instructions were unclear, but we got through it. At the end, it feels flimsy, but it does look nice. We were too nervous to put anything heavy in it, since it doesn't seem like it would hold well. Overall, if you need something 'hyper tough', I wouldn't say this is it. It's adequate for lighter items though, and it does look nice.

reviews.title: Pantry
reviews.review_text: Even though it says a garage storage I’m using mines in the basement has a pantry. The plastic is not has heavy duty has I thought it would be. Had an issue with one of the shelves getting it to lock in. But the cabinet took less than 30 minutes to snap together the instructions were easy to read and understand. The doors open and close fine and you can add a lock. Just wish the plastic was a little more stronger.

reviews.title: Hyper Tough Plastic 4-Shelf Garage Storage Utility
reviews.review_text: This is a cheap plastic cabinet. I am not sure it is worth the money to spend, but I do know how expensive other cabinets can be. This one does serve its purpose in a decent way. You do get what you pay for I guess. The instructions are lacking details in places but you can generally figure it out. There was one step missing, where it showed the picture but didn't say anything about installing the part. I did received mine with a hole in the box and 2 pieces were damaged. They were still usable and it isn't worth the hassle to replace them. The shelves are kind of difficult to "lock down" because the plastic is so bendable/warped. There is a QR code that says is a link for video instructions, but it only takes you to the Wal-Mart site for the item. I saw nowhere on that page a link for the instruction video. It is unfortunate you can only upload 2 pictures. I have many to show, good and bad.

reviews.title: Just OK, watch YouTube first
reviews.review_text: I'm usually pretty good with following directions but failed to first pull it up in YouTube. I ended up cracking a piece that fits in the top/bottom of the doors, so my unit is doorless. Not a big deal, it's inside a nook in a closet for luggage, purses, etc., not used often. Quality- a bit flimsy for the price, I would pay half at most if I had to buy again. High probability neither will happen.

reviews.title: sewing room storage
reviews.review_text: Can be a tough, easy to move when empty shelving unit ; between the shelf spaces it is high with deep space from front to back...great storage for Quilters to store finished quilts or battings. The bottom floor shelf area has plenty of room to store an oversized sewing machine. Parts pop into place and hold solid tight. Don't think in terms of "just" for the garage storage. Missing the crucial "roof" of the cabinet, and have notified them for "part missing."
